name: backdoordiplomacy

procedures: T1027::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has obfuscated tools and malware it uses with VMProtect.
T1036.004::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has disguised their backdoor droppers with naming conventions designed to blend into normal operations.
T1036.005::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has dropped implants in folders named for legitimate software.
T1046::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has used SMBTouch, a vulnerability scanner, to determine whether a target is vulnerable to EternalBlue malware.
T1049::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has used NetCat and PortQry  to enumerate network connections and display the status of related TCP and UDP ports.
T1055.001::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has dropped legitimate software onto a compromised host and used it to execute malicious DLLs.
T1074.001::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has copied files of interest to the main drive's recycle bin.
T1095::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has used EarthWorm for network tunneling with a SOCKS5 server and port transfer functionalities.
T1105::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has downloaded additional files and tools onto a compromised host.
T1120::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has used an executable to detect removable media, such as USB flash drives.
T1190::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has exploited CVE-2020-5902, an F5 BIP-IP vulnerability, to drop a Linux backdoor. [BackdoorDiplomacy] has also exploited mis-configured Plesk servers.
T1505.003::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has used web shells to establish an initial foothold and for lateral movement within a victim's system.
T1574.001::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has executed DLL search order hijacking.
T1588.001::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has obtained and used leaked malware, including DoublePulsar, EternalBlue, EternalRocks, and EternalSynergy, in its operations.
T1588.002::[BackdoorDiplomacy] has obtained a variety of open-source reconnaissance and red team tools for discovery and lateral movement.

description: [BackdoorDiplomacy](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0135) is a cyber espionage threat group that has been active since at least 2017. [BackdoorDiplomacy](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0135) has targeted Ministries of Foreign Affairs and telecommunication companies in Africa, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.(Citation: ESET BackdoorDiplomacy Jun 2021)
